title: Honoring Pamela S. Brier upon the occasion of her designation for special recognition
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Pamela S. Brier upon the occasion of her
designation  for special recognition by the Federation of Italian-Ameri-
can Organizations of Brooklyn, Ltd.

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that  the
quality  and  character of life in the communities across New York State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those  individ-
uals who devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its citi-
zenry; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is  justly proud to honor Pamela S.
Brier upon the occasion of her designation for  special  recognition  by
the  Federation  of Italian-American Organizations of Brooklyn, Ltd., to
be celebrated at its 34th Anniversary Gala on March 27. 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Since May of 2003, Pamela Brier has served as  President  and
Chief  Executive Officer of Maimonides Medical Center; since her arrival
in 1995 as Maimonides' Executive  Vice  President  and  Chief  Operating
Officer,  she  has been integral to the growth of Maimonides as a world-
class healthcare institution while, at the same time, remaining true  to
its community roots; and
  WHEREAS.  During  her  tenure,  Pamela  Brier has directed Maimonides'
efforts to improve patient care  by  implementing  new  state-of-the-art
information technology systems, recruiting top quality physicians, nurs-
es and support staff, and expanding clinical services and facilities; to
ensure  accessibility to first-rate healthcare, she increased the number
of ambulatory care facilities in the  various  communities  the  medical
center  serves; under her leadership, Maimonides has gained a widespread
reputation for delivering compassionate patient-centered care; and
  WHEREAS, Pamela Brier's  achievements  at  Maimonides  Medical  Center
reflect her extensive experience in the healthcare and hospital adminis-
tration  field, including 15 years of service in senior leadership posi-
tions at New York City's Health & Hospitals Corporation; from 1992-1995,
she served as Executive Director of Bellevue Hospital Center,  New  York
City's  oldest  and  largest public hospital; prior to that, she was New
York City's Health & Hospitals Corporation's Executive  Vice  President,
where she oversaw the management and had direct responsibilities for the
fiscal  and clinical operations of the multi-hospital system, as well as
the citywide Emergency Medical Services; and
  WHEREAS, During Pamela Brier's earlier tenure as Executive Director of
Jacobi Hospital, a large teaching hospital in the Bronx, she oversaw the
installation of the first large-scale electronic patient care system  in
the  United  States,  providing improved and coordinated quality medical
care through information technology; and
  WHEREAS, Pamela Brier's commitment to public health policy and  commu-
nity  service  are  evidenced in her many professional activities, which
include service on the New York City Board of Health, Workforce  Invest-
ment  Board,  and  Community  Service Board, the New York State Hospital
Review and Planning Council, Special Task Force on Health  Care  Reform,
and  Health  Information  Technology  Policy Summit Initiative; she also
chairs the American Hospital Association's Information Technology  Advi-
sory Group; and
  WHEREAS,  Pamela Brier has also served as Chair of the Board of Direc-
tors of Housing Works, Inc. and as a member  of  the  Commonwealth  Fund
Commission  on Women's Health; she is currently a member of the Board of
the UNITE HERE/Union Health Center;  she  also  is  an  adjunct  faculty
member  of  the  New  York  University  Wagner Graduate School of Public
Service; and

  WHEREAS, Appointed to the New York City Board of Corrections in  2008,
Pamela  Brier  was recognized by CRAIN'S NEW YORK BUSINESS as one of the
"50 Most Powerful Women in New York" in 2009; and
  WHEREAS,  Pamela  Brier earned her Bachelor of Arts degree with honors
from the University of California at Berkeley and  a  Master  of  Public
Health degree in Health Administration from the University of California
at Los Angeles; and
  WHEREAS,  Pamela Brier has distinguished herself in her profession and
in her community and truly merits the recognition  of  this  Legislative
Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Pamela S. Brier upon the occasion of her designation  for  special
recognition  by  the  Federation  of  Italian-American  Organizations of
Brooklyn, Ltd.; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Pamela S. Brier.
